title: Topic | FA Cup | The Sydney Morning Herald
body_text:
FA Cup
Underdogs Palace beat Liverpool in shootout to win Community Shield
Justin Devenny got the winner in the shootout with an emphatic penalty to give Palace a third victory at Wembley in a row.
- Sam Tobin
Latest
- Exclusive
- AFL 2025
AFL considers new mid-season competition in radical fixture shake-up
The AFL is seriously considering introducing a secondary tournament that would run during the premiership season, award millions of dollars in prizemoney and could even offer the winning team a spot in the finals.
- Sam McClure
Nine’s goal to become home of soccer with English Premier League dream
The media giant will consider a bid for the A-League broadcast rights as it closes in on a deal to acquire the rights to televising the top competitions in England.
- Calum Jaspan
Manchester United scrape into FA Cup final after astonishing Coventry comeback
Second-tier Coventry came back from three goals down to take the Premier League giants to extra time, only to lose on penalties after having a potential late winner ruled offside.
Sunday Sport Quiz: Equestrian high jinx, England’s FA Cup and who is Ralph Doubell?
Challenge yourself with our sports quiz, a mix of questions about the latest in world and local sport, and the big events in sporting history.
- Chris Berry
Ange Postecoglou’s trophy hopes fading as Manchester City knock Tottenham out of FA Cup
Spurs are out of all cup competitions, leaving them with just the Premier League to focus on – their last remaining hope of winning anything in Postecoglou’s debut season.
- Vince Rugari
‘I ain’t taking the blame for that’: Manager slams own players in X-rated FA Cup rant
Dorking Wanderers’ Marc White delivered one of the most brutal post-match assessments in the game’s history after a costly derby defeat.
- Jeremy Wilson
Manchester City edge closer to treble after FA Cup final win over Man United
Manchester City beat arch-rivals Manchester United 2-1 in the FA Cup final thanks to Ilkay Gundogan’s record-breaking double on Saturday.
- Martyn Herman
- Analysis
- For subscribers
What injury? Kerr proves her class – and fitness – again on the big stage
The Matildas captain started and ended her week carrying the Australian flag, and looks cherry ripe for the biggest month of her career.
- Vince Rugari
‘Backflip incoming’: Kerr hits winner in FA Cup final; Man City close in on Premier League title
A week after bearing Australia’s flag at the coronation, Sam Kerr carried Chelsea to another crown in front of 77,390 fans at Wembley Stadium.
- Glenn Moore
